HDG.IWM.content: why overcoming of metaphysics [Destruction] is necessary?

overcoming of metaphysics [Destruction] corresponded to endeavor to first learn to attend to oblivion of Being, to experience this oblivion, absorb this experience into relation of Being to man, preserve (verwahren) it there [ontological difference & Being] > in the need (Not) belonging to oblivion of Being, question: “What is metaphysics?” perhaps most necessary for thought > [Destruction] representational thought relinquished to thinking brought to pass (ereignetes) by Being itself, in thrall to Being (um dem Sein höriges Denken) [MOP, telos]: more thoughtful our thinking becomes, more purely our thinking will stand of its own accord in sole action appropriate to it [attention to Being]

HDG.FS.content: reading Hegel’s “dichotomy (Entzweiung) is the source of the need for philosophy” [Differenz…], Heidegger states that all attempts to suppress “tearing” must be abandoned, “tearing” im Grunde remains and must remain: “in the tearing…there always reigns (waltet) unity or a necessary conjoining (Vereinigung) that is, a living unity”

HDG.EC.content: the unnecessary is most necessary of all, only one who has learned this understands pain of human barred from thinking > thinking is thus the unnecessary, and yet thinking has a high rank of honor: the highest > I know this but don’t know the Grund of this > as if Occident couldn’t wait until thinking finds its originary essence: perhaps pure waiting, ability to wait [slow down, hastiness (Übereilung) of thinking thought as ratio, rationality]

HDG.EC.content: [facetiously?] what’s more necessary than “getting down to businesses with the given facts (Zupacken im Gegebenen), remaking what is present at hand, and moving forward w/ what has existed before (Vorwärtsbringen des Bisherigen)”? > that factual sense of reality (Tatsachensinn) lets man stand squarely on ground, validates, secures, effectuates (wirken), holds fast—and yet can’t be w/out the unnecessary (Unnötige)

HDG.OHF.content: [phenomenology beyond dialectic] dialectic directionless (richtungslos) when no Grundblick in direction of (auf) the subject matter (Sache), a rationality testing/proving itself by looking this way (i.e. not dialectically) [Heidegger uses rationality affirmatively here?] > all dialectic lives from table of others, Hegel: “this traditional material” (Plato, Aristotle) “extremely importance source, indeed a necessary condition [and] presupposition to be gratefully acknowledged” (Science of Logic) > dialectic is double-sidedly un-radical: 1) lives from hand to mouth 2) eloquent about readymade material
